title: How to Make a Tuna Wrap

steps.headline: Add the can of tuna into a bowl.
Add 10 grams of mayonnaise into the mixture.
Sprinkle some salt on top if desired.
Start mixing until all ingredients are evenly spread out.
Place the leaves over the wrap.
Overlay with a little bit of sliced up onion.
Add in the tuna paste to the left side of the wrap and the cucumber and avocado sticks to the right.
Wrap your wrap up.
steps.description: Visually divide your wrap into three strips vertically. Place your fillings down the center strip, stopping short of the ends. Fold about three inches of each end in towards the middle so they touch each other. Then roll the rest of the tortilla over at the end around the fillings.

steps.headline: Stabilize the wrap by adding in a paper wrap around it.
steps.description: The more tight the wrap the better.

steps.headline: Slice the entire wrap in half on a diagonal if desired.

text: Making the Tuna Paste Add the can of tuna into a bowl.  Add 10 grams of mayonnaise into the mixture.  Sprinkle some onion (diced) on top.  Sprinkle some salt on top if desired.  Start mixing until all ingredients are evenly spread out.  Making the wrap Place the leaves over the wrap.  Overlay with a little bit of sliced up onion.  Add in the tuna paste to the left side of the wrap and the cucumber and avocado sticks to the right.  Wrap your wrap up. Visually divide your wrap into three strips vertically. Place your fillings down the center strip, stopping short of the ends. Fold about three inches of each end in towards the middle so they touch each other. Then roll the rest of the tortilla over at the end around the fillings. Stabilize the wrap by adding in a paper wrap around it. The more tight the wrap the better. Slice the entire wrap in half on a diagonal if desired.  Serve immediately.
